text: Andrew Jackson Young (born March 12, 1932) is an American politician, diplomat, activist, and Congregationalist pastor www.georgiaencyclopedia.org from Georgia. He has served as a Congressman from Georgia's 5th congressional district, the United States Ambassador to the United Nations, and Mayor of Atlanta. He served as President of the National Council of Churches USA, and was a member of the Southern Christian Leadership Conference (SCLC) during the Civil Rights Movement. He was a supporter and friend of Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. ==References== ==Other websites== *Biography in the New Georgia Encyclopedia *Oral History Interview with Andrew Young from Oral Histories of the American South *Andrew Young School of Policy Studies *Andy Young's oral history video excerpts at The National Visionary Leadership Project *Good Works International, founder *Andrew Young's federal campaign contribution report * * **interview with Young on A Way Out of No Way: The Spiritual Memoirs of Andrew Young , Booknotes, April 3, 1994. * * * Category:1932 births Category:Living people Category:African-American politicians Category:American Calvinists Category:American civil rights activists Category:Mayors of Atlanta Category:American Christian clergy Category:Congregationalists Category:Politicians from New Orleans Category:United States Ambassadors to the United Nations Category:United States representatives from Georgia Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians Category:Writers from Georgia (U.S. state) Category:Writers from New Orleans
title: Andrew Young
